newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Telmex leads Mexico ADR surge.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Telmex leads Mexico ADR surge.

text.p: Telefonos de Mexico led a surge in Mexican companies' American Depositary Receipts Friday.
Mexican ADRs rose broadly, boosted by an increased flow of money into Latin American mutual funds, traders said.
"The main thing is that you have real money going into the U.S. Latin funds and they are buying the big markets," such as Mexico, a trader said.
"There are no sellers now. Everybody is looking at valuations in Mexico and saying, 'These stocks are cheap.'"

Telmex was up 3/4 to 48 and was the most active Mexican ADR. Among other active Mexican ADRs, Grupo Televisa rose 1/2 to 31, Grupo Radio Centro SA was up 1-1/4 to 12-3/4, and Desc Sociedad de Fomento Industrial SA Desc rose 5/8 to 28.
Among active Canadian shares, Barrick Gold Corp fell 1/2 to 23-1/8 and Abacan Resource Corp rose 3/32 to 2-11/16.
Israel's Orbotech Ltd rose three points to a 12-month high of 32-3/4 after a company executive said Orbotech was eyeing acquisitions and could announce a major purchase this year.
Australia's Westpac Banking Corp rose 1/4 to 29-3/4 in heavy trading.
Decliners led advancers 233 to 212 among 814 ADRs. The ADR group was unchanged in late morning and volume was 34 million shares.
ADRs allow U.S. trade of foreign shares.
